text:
Hi Sean! Nice to e-meet you :wave:and great question, thank you for asking!
Some great getting started resources for our APIs are:
• HubSpot Academy Course - <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/introduction-to-HubSpot-apis|Introduction to HS APIs>
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/en/docs-beta/idea-tracker-tutorial-part-1|Walkthrough of connecting a custom app to HS CRM>
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview|Getting started section on our API docs>
Let me know if this gives you what you need to start building or if we can provide any other helpful guides or resources :slightly_smiling_face:
Hi Jacob, can you send an example of the filter you are using so I can see what property and value you are filtering for?

Hey everyone! I am trying to create a new contact from Contacts API with generic email id like Gmail, Hotmail etc.. now I want to associate that contact to a company already exists in HubSpot. Any IDEA how to do that?
Hello Guys, need help with HubSpot Transactional Emails.

We have customer who want us to integrate transactional emails with their Portal, as we need to test things. we have to used our development portal. There is no Transactional Email Addon added to test things.

Can any one help how to get an access for it and test Transactional Emails Add-on.

Thanks in advance!
Hi Erik, that is currently an expected result. The low permissions user will not be able to view the entire deal record, but some limited information may show up an associated records

Sure!  For example the following body returns all companies in our account, regardless of our custom property’s value.

`{`
    `"filtergroups":[`
      `{`
        `"filters":[`
       
         `{`
            `"propertyName": "customer_status",`
            `"operator" : "EQ",`
            `"value": "Active"`
        `}`
        `]`
    `}`
    `],`
   
    
    `"properties": [`
        `"name",`
        `"domain",`
        `"customer_status"`
    `],`
    `"limit": 10,`
    `"after": 0`

 

`}`
If I were to take the filter group out and just do the filter, it would work, but this is just a simple example.  We would need filter groups for what we are trying to do.

contacts are associated with companies based upon email domain. someone like `<mailto:frank@gmail.com|frank@gmail.com>` isn't going to get associated with a company, but `<mailto:frank@HubSpot.com|frank@HubSpot.com>` and `<mailto:ginger@HubSpot.com|ginger@HubSpot.com>` would be assocaited with HubSpot, the company
You can likely spin up a new enterprise account or whatever you need to ensure you have that, then copy those over -- Maybe someone here can get it added, but I'm not sure
BTW the new api doc where we can test calls right from the doc is amazing!!!
im just happy that added a text in postman feature
is not there any way to associate these type of contacts? actually I have local DB to upload on HubSpot :disappointed:
It’s all great features, but the view is really cramped. I would love the option of a full-size docs.
